meanings.definition: A person regarded as eccentric or crazy.
meanings.sent1: The kooks in the neighborhood always wear colorful hats.
meanings.sent2: The town had a few kooks who believed in aliens.
meanings.sent3: The kooks at the party danced wildly to the music.
meanings.sent4: The old house was filled with kooks who collected odd trinkets.
meanings.sent5: The kooks in the play wore mismatched socks and sang loudly.

meanings.definition: To act in a strange or eccentric manner.
meanings.sent1: She kooks around the house, pretending to be a superhero.
meanings.sent2: The children always kooks when they play dress-up.
meanings.sent3: He kooks by speaking in funny voices to his plants.
meanings.sent4: The comedian kooks on stage to make people laugh.
meanings.sent5: The actor kooks in the movie by wearing a silly costume.
